31st July 2004…. Today we went to watch thirty days in September at the actor’s studio, Bangsar. Before that, I am looking forward to watch this play actually because I always believe that the feeling of watch the play is different from just reading the script. I thought it will be only our TESL semester 5 students went to watch this play, to my surprise that, our junior also join us to watch it. Furthermore, everyone looks different today because they wear very smart today. It can not be deny that it is an advantage to read the script before going to watch the play. Because we can know what is the play about and when we watch it, perhaps the questions we have during reading the script will be answered. But there is disadvantage too if we read the script before the play, since we know what is the play about, we will not feel any surprise when we watch it. For me, the actors’ act in this play is quite good; it can see that many efforts they had contributed in this play. Just perhaps I had read the script, I had known what will happen next, and it seems do not have any surprise there. One thing that I remember one part of the play, I heard the sound of raining and lighting, I thought it raining outside, in fact, it is the sound effect for this play. Anyway, it is really a good experience for me to watch this play.

I had read the summary of King Lear; I found that I had read the story before that similar to it when I was in primary school. It is also about a king who has three daughters and the king asked his daughters how much they love him. It was in the primary school magazine, off course it was in mandarin version. May be that time when I read it, it was in a simple version, now, I can read a complete version of it. The problems that I faced when I read King Lear are it is quite difficult to find out what the characters’ speech means. And I am still confusing about the characters’ name; perhaps I need some time to remember the characters’ name. The guideline that I got this week, I think it is quite helpful and useful for us, because it guides us how to read a play. Sometimes, I wonder how many times a play should be read in order to understand it thoroughly. I think we should read it many times. May be different time we read, we will get different things.

The first time I see this title, I think that it will be a boring play, but it so surprise to me, it is an interesting play. I am looking forward to read the tragedy of King Lear……

Every country has their own traditional dance, this only I know when I type in traditional dance and it gives many results of traditional dance in different countries. As a Malaysian, I think we are fortunately because we can get to know different traditional dances from different races in our country. I had browsed through a website- www.dancemalaysia.com, in this website; it let me know more about traditional dance in Malaysia. After I browsed through this website, I realized that different dance brings different meaning. For example: Chinese dance meant to bring success and prosperity and others meant to celebrate certain occasion. Besides that, Indian dance is a form of workshop and an expression of the human emotion. Court dance is one of the Malay traditional dances; it began as entertainment for the royal household and used to be performed by the maidens and ladies in waiting for the court. But now these dances are performed for the public venues. We should proud that we still have chance to watch this kind of traditional dance. In my opinion, every kind of traditional dance should be continued in order not to be forgotten by the young generation. Because every traditional dance has their own unique culture and meaning.
